Package ca.mcgill.ecse458.tcpserver.repository

Class RobotResponseRepository

java.lang.Object
ca.mcgill.ecse458.tcpserver.repository.RobotResponseRepository
@Component public class RobotResponseRepository extends Object

Repository that stores the responses received from robots in a deque.

The contents of the deque are modified using a lock and wait-notify methods for thread-safety.

Currently only used with the AI response writer and for testing purposes but may be extended for additional functionality.

Author:
Ze Yuan Fu
See Also:
  • ca.mcgill.ecse458.tcpserver.message.Message

  • Method Details

    • putMessage

      public void putMessage(Message message)
      Adds a message to the deque in the last position
      Parameters:
      message - Message to add to the repository

    • removeMessage

      public Message removeMessage()
      Removes and returns the first message in the repository. If the repository is empty, waits until a message is added, then retrieves it.
      Returns:
      First message in the repository

    • hasMessageById

      private boolean hasMessageById(int id)
      Helper function to determine if the queue contains a message with the specified ID
      Parameters:
      id - ID of robot
      Returns:
      True if the repository contains a response from the robot thread with the given ID, false otherwise

    • getResponseById

      public Message getResponseById(int id)
      Removes and returns the first message from the robot with the specified ID. If the repository does not contain a such message, waits until the robot with the specified ID has sent a response to the repository, then retrieves it
      Parameters:
      id - ID of robot
      Returns:
      First message from the robot with the specified ID

    • getQueueSize

      public int getQueueSize()
      Returns the number of messages in the repository
      Returns:
      Number of messages in the repository

    • emptyQueue

      public void emptyQueue()
      Empties the repository (mostly used for testing purposes)
